sentences.en: He is in the climactic moments of his career.
sentences.cn: 他正处于事业的顶峰阶段。

sentences.en: In Episode III, viewers will see the climactic finale of the Clone Wars.
sentences.cn: 在星球大战第三集, 观众将看到克隆人战争的巅峰结局.

sentences.en: In reality, my momentous coming out was anti - climactic and disappointing.
sentences.cn: 但事实上, 这次意义重大的出走,最后还是草草地结束了,让人很失望.

sentences.en: Instead, in the bright drawing - room, all seemed serene , anti - climactic, and slightly comic.
sentences.cn: 相反地, 在这光亮的客厅里, 一切都显得安详 、 平淡, 而且稍有些滑稽.

sentences.en: Set in the low - lying Ganges – Brahmaputra River Delta, Bangladesh sits a perfect storm of climactic conditions.
sentences.cn: 坐落于地势低洼的恒河-布拉马普特拉河三角洲, 孟加拉具有形成最糟糕风暴的适宜气候条件.

sentences.en: We whomped our arch rival in the season's climactic football game.
sentences.cn: 我们在该季最精彩足球赛中打败了我们主要的对手.

words.tran_cn: 高潮的；顶点的；渐层法的

trans.tran_en: forming a very exciting or important part of an event or story, especially near the end of it
